intro: Pleurogyne sulcata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed ironwood, is a shrub native to the arid regions of Australia. It is characterized by its small, narrow leaves that are often covered in a fine, whitish powder, which helps reduce water loss in harsh environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is adapted to survive in low-nutrient soils and can withstand prolonged periods of drought. Pleurogyne sulcata plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for native wildlife.
